phrases.text: Hỡi anh gánh nước quang mây
phrases.english: Hey you, water carrier under the bright sky

culturalContext.description: Opening address to a water carrier, common figure in Vietnamese village life
facts: Water carriers (gánh nước) were essential in traditional Vietnamese villages before modern plumbing
The phrase 'quang mây' (bright sky) creates romantic, poetic imagery
culturalContext.musicalContext: Exclamatory opening phrase to catch attention

phrases.text: Em xin một gáo lưới cây ngô đồng
phrases.english: I ask for a ladle from the ngô đồng tree net

culturalContext.description: Request for water using traditional Vietnamese imagery
facts: Gáo (ladle) was traditionally made from coconut shells or wood
Ngô đồng refers to a type of tree or place name in folk songs

phrases.text: Ơi hỡi người tình nhân ơi i hi
phrases.english: Oh my dear lover, oh i hi

culturalContext.description: Emotional exclamation to a loved one with traditional vocables
facts: Người tình nhân is classical term for romantic partner
i hi are traditional vocables used in Vietnamese folk music for emotional expression
culturalContext.musicalContext: Emotional peak with vocables, common in ví dặm style

phrases.text: Sông Bắc thì qua lời nọ
phrases.english: Cross the Northern river with those words

culturalContext.description: Reference to crossing rivers, common theme in separation and travel songs
facts: Sông Bắc (Northern river) often symbolizes separation in Vietnamese folk songs
River crossing represents journey or separation from loved ones

phrases.english: You pass through that mountain pass over there

culturalContext.description: Continuation of journey theme through mountain passes
facts: Mountain passes (đèo) are challenging geographic features in Vietnam
Đèo often symbolizes difficult journeys or separation in folk songs
culturalContext.musicalContext: Closing phrase describing the difficult journey ahead

patterns.dominantTheme: Request and journey, water carrier and mountain pass imagery
